creator: peter.speybrouck@gmail.com
text:
compiling apache on skyos
=> uses the unix code
skyos does not have writev support so anything in #ifdef HAVE_WRITEV will not be
available from apr, apr checks for writev.
=> apr_socket_sendv in srclib/apr/network_io/unix/sendrecv.c is not available
=> apache uses this function in server/core_filters.c so results in a undefined
reference

solution: use the beos definition of apr_socket_sendv with ifdef:
#ifdef SKYOS
/* SkyOS doesn't have writev for sockets so we use the following instead...
 */
APR_DECLARE(apr_status_t) apr_socket_sendv(apr_socket_t * sock, 
                                           const struct iovec *vec,
                                           apr_int32_t nvec, apr_size_t *len)
{
    *len = vec[0].iov_len;
    return apr_socket_send(sock, vec[0].iov_base, len);
}
#endif

or a check for writev should be added
